text.autoconfig.yigd.title: You're in Grave Danger
text.autoconfig.yigd.option.graveSetting: If graves should be generated on death

How players can retrieve their items from graves
ON_USE: Right click the grave
ON_SNEAK: Sneak on top of th grave
ON_STAND: Step on top of the grave
ON_BREAK: Break the grave
If enabled, every item will try stacking with another item if assigned slot is occupied
For those who want a more realistic experience. Because IRL you need a shovel to loot a grave

How items should be retrieved from graves
IN_INVENTORY: Items go straight into your inventory, in the same slots as when you died
ON_GROUND: All items land on the ground as if you broke a chest
If true, players will drop their head when they die
If true, graves will drop as blocks when they are used
If true, players are required to carry a grave block for one to generate
If false, graves will not generate if they do not contain any items or XP
If false, graves can not be claimed in area affected by spawn protection

What should happen when you die in a spawn protected area
KEEP_ITEMS: You keep all your items
DROP_ITEMS: You drop your items like normal minecraft
CREATE_GRAVE: A grave is created

What inventory should be prioritized.
GRAVE: Your inventory will be generated on top of grave inventory
INVENTORY: Grave inventory will be generated on top of your inventory
Configure if and how other players can retrieve your grave
If set to true, other players will be able to loot your grave
If set to true, only the player that killed you can rob your grave
Will decide after how long grave robbing is possible. Set to 0 to be instant

What inventory should be prioritized.
GRAVE: Your inventory will be generated on top of grave inventory
INVENTORY: Grave inventory will be generated on top of your inventory
If users should find out who robbed their grave
If player will be told when their grave is robbed
If graves are allowed to expire
The time unit used by After Time
If true, grave will drop its items on de-spawn
Allow graves to be unlocked through grave GUI
Configure if items can be destroyed on death
If false, soulbound items can be destroyed
If true, full stacks will be destroyed. If false, only single items
If true, specified range use numbers as percentages. If false, range will use item/stack count
Lower number in range of how many items can be deleted
Upper number in range of how many items can be deleted. If lower or equal to lower limit, items lost will always be same as lower limit
Specify the probability of each selected item to actually be destroyed
Any entity can spawn by a random chance when looting a grave

Put ${owner.name} to get grave owner's name, ${owner.uuid} for grave owner UUID
Same can be used with ${looter.name} and ${looter.uuid} for the one who is looting the grave
${item[n]} can be used for the item in slot n, and writing ${!item[n]} the item will be removed from the grave

Removes items with this enchantment from the grave. Gives Curse of Vanishing effect. Useful if soulbound items are ignored and ends up in both your inventory and your grave
Format: [namespace]:[enchantment_name]

Items with this enchantment will not generate in graves, but be kept by the player when they respawn.
Format: [namespace]:[enchantment_name]
When dying with anything soulbound, soulbound will lose a level. If only one level is present, enchantment will be removed. Works for all soulbound enchantments
Items in these slots will always be deleted when respawning
Items in these slots will not go away when you die
If curse of binding should be applied when opening graves
If true, grave will generate on the block you were last standing
Try to place grave using a block whitelist. Whitelist is a block tag located at data/yigd/tags/blocks/soft_whitelist.json. Defaulted to air, water, and lava

Try to place grave using a block blacklist. Blacklist is a block tag located at data/yigd/tags/blocks/replace_blacklist.json. Defaulted to bedrock only. This will be a more precise death position than soft replace
Should the block replaced by the grave replace the grave as it's removed?

With this config set to true, graves will not disappear when claiming them. Instead when clicking claimed
graves you can see which day and how a player died. You can also move these graves with silk touch after they've been claimed
When a grave is destroyed (not claimed) should anything be dropped?

Dimensions with their ID in this list will not generate graves

You can see the dimension ID in the bottom of the top left F3 display (9th row from the top)
If a grave should generate when you fall into the void
Define a list with damage source names that should result in no grave generating
What Y level a grave should spawn at when you die in the void

If no block can be overwritten with a grave, what should happen with your items?
SET_GRAVE: Place a grave where you died (replace blacklisted block)
DROP_ITEMS: Drop all your items where you died
If false, xp will drop outside grave on death
Set XP drop to minecraft default
How many percent of your XP should be stored in the grave. This will only make a difference if "Default XP Drop" is set to false
Config for the block generated under the grave, if it spawn in the air
If a block should generate under the grave if the grave spawns in the air or over the void. Whitelist can be specified at data/yigd/tags/blocks/support_replace_whitelist.json
Block generated under grave in the overworld dimension
Block generated under grave in the nether dimension
Block generated under grave in the end dimension
Block generated under grave in custom dimensions
If set to false, there won't spawn a block under the grave when dying in claims or spawn protected area
Send a message to a player telling them where they died
LevelZ XP compatibility. Set to false if you want no integration between the mods
How many percent of your XP progress should be saved by your grave

Configure claim mod compatibility when dying on claimed land
KEEP_ITEMS: You keep all your items
DROP_ITEMS: You drop your items like normal minecraft
CREATE_GRAVE: A grave is created
If graves should first try to generate in closest the graveyard graveyard
Chunk radius of how far the game should search for closest graveyard structure
Keep all trinket items when dying
Changes the way graves render, and makes the render customizable
If false, grave will only have a static model, and no dynamic render
If a shadow should be rendered for the grave text
Render grave ground layer as the block the grave is on top of
If true player will see their graves with the glowing effect (through walls). Required true on server to work
The minimum distance from which graves should use the glow effect. Default to 0 blocks
Graves will not be able to appear glowing if further than this many blocks away. Defaulted to 10, and WILL NOT go beyond chunk render distance
Highest amount of deaths backed up for each player. Only connected to grave items, and not the graves themselves
text.autoconfig.yigd.option.utilitySetti: Configs to the soulbound enchantment [Require restart]
If the mod should use the built in soulbound enchant
If true, enchantment will not show up in the enchantment table
If the enchantment will be offered by villagers
If true, enchantment can generate on items found in loot chests and similar
Configs to the death sight enchantment [Require restart]
If the mod should use the built in death sight enchant, which will cause all graves to glow when applied to helmet.
If true, enchantment will not show up in the enchantment table
If the enchantment will be offered by villagers
If true, enchantment can generate on items found in loot chests and similar
Configs for the scroll item, which has configurable behaviour

SCROLL_OF_RETURN: Right click to teleport back to your grave
INFO_SCROLL: Right click to view grave info
DISABLED: Item will not exist
If the player should retrieve a scroll on respawn
Keys allowing other people to unlock graves
Require a key no matter if the grave is yours or not
Get a key for your newest grave when you respawn
Allows you to retrieve a key from a button in the grave GUI
Rebindable means you can shift + right click to bind the key to your latest grave

Which scope the keys will target
GRAVE: Different keys for all graves
PLAYER: Different keys for all players
ALL: All keys can unlock all graves (preferably used as an admin only item)
Configure compasses that points to your death location
text.autoconfig.yigd.option.commandToggl: Show the contents of your own grave(s). OP not required
Show the contents of someone else's grave(s). OP required
Clear grave backup data for one or more players
Actually does nothing on itself. Arguments are required
Toggles whitelist between whitelist and blacklist mode
Toggles the coordinate command that quickly shows your latest grave coordinates in chat
enchantment.yigd.soulbound.desc: Keep your items beyond the grave
text.yigd.message.too_fast: You can not retrieve your items in less than a second
text.yigd.message.timeout: Your grave has been deleted due to you not retrieving it in time
text.yigd.message.timeout.dropped: Your grave has been deleted and dropped your items due to you not retrieving it in time
text.yigd.message.timeout.offline: While you were offline a grave of yours has been deleted due to you not retrieving it in time
text.yigd.message.robbed: One of your graves has been robbed
text.yigd.message.robbed_by: One of your graves has been robbed by %s
text.yigd.message.robbed.offline: While you were offline a grave of yours has been robbed
text.yigd.message.robbed_by.offline: While you were offline a grave of yours has been robbed by %s
text.yigd.message.retrieve.missing_permi: You are not allowed to retrieve these items
text.yigd.message.retrieve.missing_key: You need a key to retrieve your items
text.yigd.message.retrieve.rob_cooldown: You can retrieve the items from this grave in: %d:%d:%d
text.yigd.message.requires_shovel: You can't dig up a grave without a shovel!
text.yigd.message.unclaimed_grave_missin: %s does not have any unclaimed graves
text.yigd.message.rob_command.fail: Could not find grave to fetch
text.yigd.message.rob_command.victim: A server operator has robbed your grave
text.yigd.message.restore_command.fail: Could not find grave to fetch
text.yigd.message.view_command.fail: %s does not have any registered graves
text.yigd.message.scroll_error: Something went wrong.. The game believes you are holding a %s
text.yigd.message.grave_now_gone: The grave you're trying to find does no longer exist
text.yigd.message.you_have_no_graves: You do not have any graves
text.yigd.message.missing_grave_location: Your grave does not have a registered location
text.yigd.message.cross_dim_error: You can't travel to your grave from another dimension
text.yigd.message.grave_location_info:
Your grave has been generated at
X: %d / Y: %d / Z: %d / %s
text.yigd.message.missing_permission: You're not allowed to execute the function linked to this command
text.yigd.message.backup.restore.fail: This player can't restore their items right now
text.yigd.message.whitelist.to_whitelist: Whitelist will now act as a whitelist
text.yigd.message.whitelist.to_blacklist: Whitelist will now act as a blacklist
text.yigd.gui.grave_select.title: Grave Select
text.yigd.gui.grave_view.title: Grave contents of %s
text.yigd.gui.grave_view.title.missing: How tf did you find this grave. It has no owner
text.yigd.gui.player_select.title: Player Select
text.yigd.gui.config_warning.message: An error occurred when loading yigd.toml (You're in Grave Danger config file). Default configs are thus loaded. Delete the yigd.toml config file to reset the configs, and this popup should disappear
